intro: Dissochaeta celebica var. contracta, commonly known as the narrowleaf dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often clustered at the base of the stem, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. This variant is distinguished by its reduced leaf width compared to other varieties within the species.
